title: Codex Sinaiticus 1844 Alexandrian Greek NT images
description:
Page scans from codexsinaiticus dot org of a Greek presentation of the Bible.

For over 100 years, Bible translators have believed that the printed editions
of transcriptions of codex Sinaiticus honestly represented what it contains,
but this is simply not the case.  It is no small matter that a view of the
actual codex has not been available to translators, much less to the general
public, but that this codex has been presented as if it were the most ancient
and well preserved extant Greek New Testament.  Because of Sinaiticus, whose
true form was somehow kept from public view, modern Bible translations are
littered with footnotes that boil down to "this is probably wrong" on every
page.  All that translators have is "critical edition" texts, which liberally
refer to Sinaiticus as the best and most noble truth.  Since Sinaiticus is so
full of uncertainty, there is always going to be a new excuse to revise the
critical text
